comments:
Hi,

I have a lot of projects closed and then open again because i work on a lot of different things at the same time.
But a project that is closed and i have a synchronization of in the synchronization view will always report an error when i start up eclipse.

errors like:

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource /iridium is not open.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.checkAccessible(Project.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Container.members(Container.java:181)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Container.members(Container.java:164)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.members(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.accept(Subscriber.java:428)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.accept(Subscriber.java:417)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.accept(Subscriber.java:389)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.subscribers.SubscriberDiffTreeEventHandler.collectAll(SubscriberDiffTreeEventHandler.java:149)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.subscribers.SubscriberEventHandler.processEvent(SubscriberEventHandler.java:337)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.processEvents(BackgroundEventHandler.java:329)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler$1.run(BackgroundEventHandler.java:173)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)


Which is not needed. If the project is closed then it should just ignore this fact and do nothing (until the project is opened)
